rev.desc.rev.desc: log assignment change in start panel
To use the category file name which is defined in Object intead of using category directly.
Custom alerts in Incident Management are not deleted after a ticket is closed.
add RAD "setup.engine.alerts" after panel "decide" and "distribute"
Custom alerts in Incident Management are not deleted after a ticket is closed.
Panel: setup.start
changed the statements from
if (status in $L.new="reopened") then (reopen.time in $L.new=$L.now)
if (status in $L.new="reopened") then (reopened.by in $L.new=$L.operator)
to
if (status in $L.new="reopened" and not same(status in $L.new, status in $L.old)) then (reopen.time in $L.new=$L.now)
if (status in $L.new="reopened" and not same(status in $L.new, status in $L.old)) then (reopened.by in $L.new=$L.operator)
panel: set.alerts
Old Problem Record: $L.old
Delete panel decide.sla and get.sla
Set $L.mode on start panel based on trigger type.
On get.sla panel, added agreement.ids in $L.file to the parm list.
Schedule records were not being generated at all...
updated the normal exit on the start panel to go to 'setup.globals' instead of 'delete.alerts'.
Removed call to obsolete function sysdistactive()
Added logic to cleanup closed.by and close.time when getting a reopen via event services.
Call sc.get.sla when getting incident through eventin
Added enable in $G.cm.control to the decision condition on the check.billing panel.
Modified so that alert process is no longer used for automatic unsuspend.
reverted the normal exit changes from previous (devtx I0609) back to original values

devtx I0609 - Removed 4th line of decision panel, check.escalate, from RAD=trigger.probsummary.edit and changed the normal exit from "prepare.build" to "decide". Removed 3rd line of decision panel, check.set.alerts, from RAD=trigger.probsummary.edit and changed the normal exit from "set.alerts" to "decide".
Hooked into new SLA code.

Added conditions to check.escalate and check.set.alerts decision panels to ensure that suspend/unsuspend processing occurs regardless of whether or not the suspend old-style alerts flag is true in the slacontrol config record.
Pass in correct flag to delete all records.
Modified processing line on the setup.start panel. Changed:

if same(nullsub(full.name in $G.pm.environment, full.name in $G.pm.global.environment), true) then ($L.operator=nullsub($lo.ufname, nullsub(operator(), "NULL"))) else ($L.operator=nullsub(operator(), "NULL"))
to:
if nullsub(full.name in $G.pm.global.environment, false) then ($L.operator=nullsub($lo.ufname, nullsub(operator(), "NULL"))) else ($L.operator=nullsub(operator(), "NULL"))
The original statement was making reference to full.name in $G.pm.environment which is a character field, and not a logical field.
Modification made for CenterPoint Task 20808 for Request 19921.

RAD application pm.delete.alert now expects a parameter (Delete Deadline Alerts?) that tells it whether or not to delete deadline alerts. This application (trigger.probsummary.edit) modified to pass the right value to it.
See the document named CtrPntTsk20808Rqs19921.doc attached to CenterPoint Task 20808 for Request 19921 for details of what was done.
Previous change was for scr 19630
Added delete of the alert records.
Fixed a problem where alerts were being deleted incorrectly.
Moved check for environment variables to after the apm.setup.globals call.
recompile only.
Modified for new engine code.
Panel sla.delta had been changed to call sla.problem.change.state.wrapper instead of sla.problem.change.state
Call the distributed code if paging is being used.
Changes to apm.setup.globals already fixed this.
Don't error if an error is encountered in apm.setup.globals
removed work management stamping; its not needed anymore since the work management data is stored in work
Use same() to set $L.distribute to account for "unknown" case.
Fixed spelling error. ( $L.distrubute )
Work Management Stamping
Move reference to global variable to after setup.globals is called.
Now calls setup.globals
changed error exit on apm.distribute panel to $normal.
The binaries no longer seem to like it whaen you pass $INTO.NEW into a subroutine. I changed it so I passed a local reference to the relation e.g. $L.file and now all seems well
Fixed a bug wherein the sla state change wouldn't get called for an initial problem open event
Problem state changes will now only be processed asynchronously IF the "bg.clock" environment option is selected
Problem State changes are now going to be processed Asynchronously
Fixed a typo
Will now not call the SLA processing code if no sla is associated with this ticket
Linked in code to call sla status change code

descript.descript: log assignment change in start panel
To use the category file name which is defined in Object intead of using category directly.
Custom alerts in Incident Management are not deleted after a ticket is closed.
add RAD "setup.engine.alerts" after panel "decide" and "distribute"
Custom alerts in Incident Management are not deleted after a ticket is closed.

changed the statements from

to

Added logic to cleanup closed.by and close.time when getting a reopen via event services.
Call sc.get.sla when getting incident through eventin
Added enable in $G.cm.control to the decision condition on the check.billing panel.
Modified so that alert process is no longer used for automatic unsuspend.
reverted the normal exit changes from previous (devtx I0609) back to original values
